byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and GRIFF PALMER
byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr., Susan Saulny and Derek Willis contributed reporting.

abstract: Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney has raised far more money than President Obama in 2011 from top Wall Street donors; gap underscores the growing alienation between Obama and financial professionals, as well as Romney's aggressive and successful efforts to woo them.
snippet: Campaign finance reports underscore a growing alienation from President Obama among many rank-and-file financial professionals and Mitt Romney’s aggressive efforts to woo them.
lead_paragraph: Campaign finance reports underscore a growing alienation from President Obama among many rank-and-file financial professionals and Mitt Romney’s aggressive efforts to woo them.

headline.main: Romney Beating Obama in a Fight for Wall St. Cash
headline.print_headline: Romney Beating Obama in a Fight For Wall St. Cash
headline.seo: Romney, Perry and Cain Open Wide Financial Lead Over Field
